version_description:
Includes 18 workouts for the new Infinity Rope System
Allows you to target your fitness goals of burning fat or boosting endurance
Skill mode includes basic jump, alternate foot, side to side, and double unders
New workout results page shows estimated calories burned based on your personal profile
Listen to your music while using the app.  Select an iTunes playlist or streaming app prior to opening the Crossrope app and jump to your beats!

Includes 18 workouts for the new Infinity Rope System
Allows you to target your fitness goals of burning fat or boosting endurance
Skill mode includes basic jump, alternate foot, side to side, and double unders
New workout results page shows estimated calories burned based on your personal profile
Listen to your music while using the app.  Select an iTunes playlist or streaming app prior to opening the Crossrope app and jump to your beats!
Stability fixes and improvements.

Thank you all for the helpful feedback. Since our recent redesign, we have been working hard to create a better app experience for our customers. This new version of the app includes a newly designed timer screen which makes it easier to follow along with your favorite workouts. You are now able to better view the timer from a distance, rotate your screen to landscape mode, and even change the timer between a light and dark theme for preferred contrast. At the same time, we've updated the profile page, added sound volume options, updated our sharing screen, and removed any existing bugs. Enjoy!
Bug fixes
Bug fixes

- Create a profile and save your progress;
- Bug Fixes;

We made small design changes to clean up the overall experience.
- Added a left menu
- Redesign workouts main page
- Access all sound settings (the type of voice, voice volume, and beep volume) on the timer page
- Refreshed images
- bug fixes;

- removed audio ducking so you can listen to your music uninterrupted
- app can now run in background so you can use your camera features without pausing workout
- simplified challenge workout preview page
- bug fixes and performance improvements

- NEW activity tracking feature is now available so you can track your workouts and challenges as well as total calories burned
- made registration experience easier and smoother
- improved challenge flow to let you find your next workout more quickly
- bug fixes and performance improvements
- activity bug fix;

- custom workout feed gives you access to fresh new jump rope and bodyweight workouts every week
- new workout preview screen gives you a quick overview of what your workout looks like. Instantly see which ropes you need, which exercises you'll be doing, and more.
- new workout rating feature lets you rate your completed workouts and choose new workouts based on popularity
- minor improvements and bug fixes

- workout ratings now only appear once
- various bug fixes and improvements;

- More bug fixes
- Improved user experience
New Feature: Now you can sync your workouts with your Health app

Skip, rate, and review challenges
Bug fixes

- Improved workout preview screen for better overview of workouts
- Improved workout timer with new transition screens to show upcoming exercises for each workout block
- Bug fixes
- Bug fixes
- Bug fixes
Bug fixes

This is our biggest release we’ve rolled out to date! We’re launching our new Crossrope Pro Membership that gives you access to some of our best features yet - unlimited access to workouts and challenges, quick workout filtering options, and our NEW Crossrope Count™ feature that counts your jump rope repetitions for you. All existing features remain free with the Crossrope Basic Membership. We’ve also made some improvements: 

• Added metric units in the profile
• Improved interaction for the activity section
• Added the ability to favorite workouts
• User experience enhancements
App enhancement and improved workout timer + bug fixes
Bug fixes and usability improvements

Lots of exciting changes to help you enjoy Crossrope more!
- Now you can do workouts in landscape mode!
- Larger font during workouts, so exercises are easier to read from a distance
- Bubbles on the workout list so you know which ropes are used
- Link to the Crossrope Jump Rope community from the menu
- Fixed the issue with high battery usage during workouts

Please reach out to us at appfeedback@crossrope.com with any comments or suggestions!

More exciting updates to help you enjoy the Crossrope app!
 
Now you can skip ahead to the next exercise interval during your workouts. Whether you’re pressed for time or still learning the moves, you can keep enjoying Crossrope workouts on your own terms.

You spoke and we listened — now you can find beginner workouts and content in our new ‘Beginner’ tab. Master your jumping skills, learn new footwork, try our Beginner Challenge, and improve at your own pace. Everything you need to start your jump rope journey is waiting for you in this new section of our app.
You spoke and we listened — including updated screenshots and preview videos showing off our new workout timer
You spoke and we listened - Including an improved onboarding experience and a fix so that tutorial videos can be shown

New year. New App. We’ve made loads of updates to help support you in your fitness journey with Crossrope. Here’s what you can expect in our new and improved release: 
- Workout filtering for all users – search by difficulty, length, workout type, and more.
- A modern look and feel
- Dark mode 
- Easier access to Activity monitoring and the Shop tab
- A clean new workout preview screen so it’s easy to browse workouts
- A more in-depth workout settings page
- Better support for older devices to resolve slow load times and crashes

New year. New App. We’ve made loads of updates to help support you in your fitness journey with Crossrope, along with some new bug fixes. Here’s what you can expect in our new and improved release: 
- Workout filtering for all users – search by difficulty, length, workout type, and more.
- A modern look and feel
- Dark mode 
- Easier access to Activity monitoring and the Shop tab
- A clean new workout preview screen so it’s easy to browse workouts
- A more in-depth workout settings page
- Better support for older devices to resolve slow load times and crashes

New year. New App. We’ve made loads of updates to help support you in your fitness journey with Crossrope, along with some new bug fixes. Here’s what you can expect in our new and improved release:
- Updated the Workout Preview to include a full list of each block and interval with durations
- Fixed a bug that could cause workouts to pause your music or podcasts
- Added Jump Only workout filter
- Added Ropes workout filter
- Fixed an issue that prevented some users from seeing all of their Challenge progress
- Fixed an issue where data wasn't synced properly for users with multiple devices 
- Fixed activity issue where dates weren't correct

New year. New App. We’ve made loads of updates to help support you in your fitness journey with Crossrope, including:
- Workout streaks, so you can see how many days in a row you've jumped
- Updated workout timer so it's easier to see the upcoming interval time
- Messages congratulating you after a workout

Jump rope. Get fit. Have fun. We’ve made loads of updates to help support you in your fitness journey with Crossrope, including:
- Fixing an issue where dates in the activity tab were off by one
- Updating our calories burned calculation to be more accurate
- Adding support so you can open our push notifications to be taken to that specific screen in the app
- Easily letting you see your most recent activity, including your current workout streak, right after a workout

Jump rope. Get fit. Have fun. We've made lots of improvements for you, including:
- Ability to sign in after a workout to be able to calculate calories burned
- Improved onboarding experience
- Improved support for deep linking to a specific workout or challenge
- Option to invite a friend

Jump rope. Get fit. Have fun. We've made lots of improvements for you, including:
- Better explanation of programs vs challenges
- Improved workout preview screen
- Updated Crossrope Premium page
- Bug fixes and usability improvements
- Fixed a bug that caused extraneous Apple Health workouts to be saved when using the Apple Watch app.

- Fixes to Apple Health and Apple Watch app to make sure workouts are reliably counted, and calories burned is used from the Apple Watch if available
- New "Recommended for you" area where you can easily resume challenges and programs you're doing and see other recommendations on great workouts for you

- Badges! Achieve badges as you use the Crossrope app and complete workouts, challenges, and Crossrope Count sessions
- Updated Activity screen, including more information on challenges in progress and total workout duration
- Fixes to Apple Health integration for customers with Apple Watches

If you love the Crossrope app, please leave us a review on the App Store!
We love feedback, please email us at appfeedback@crossrope.com with any comments or suggestions to make the app even better.

Time Trials! Now you can time yourself jumping and compete against your best times with Race, Timed, and Free modes. Available now to Premium subscribers.

If you love the Crossrope app, please leave us a review on the App Store!

We love feedback, please email us at appfeedback@crossrope.com with any comments or suggestions to make the app even better.

- Now you use your Apple Watch with Time Trials! Also, Time Trials now give you credit for workouts in Apple Health if you'd like
- Section to help new users get started in the All segment

If you love the Crossrope app, please leave us a review on the App Store!

We love feedback, please email us at appfeedback@crossrope.com with any comments or suggestions to make the app even better.

Improvements to Ladders. Try them out today for a self-paced, efficient, and competitive workout.

If you love the Crossrope app, please leave us a review on the App Store!

We love feedback, please email us at appfeedback@crossrope.com with any comments or suggestions to make the app even better.
